intro: Callicoma stutzeri var. glabrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed callicoma, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. This variety is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
